metadata.name: May rain #91
metadata.description:
The city where I live is always raining in May. 
May rain is a p5.js project made for all the rainy days in May.

Press [S] key to save as a PNG file.

metadata.name: Lost Grid #7
metadata.description:
Grid Series #1.


Press "s" to get a 2000x2000 pixels png.

metadata.name: Visa to the stars #501
metadata.description:
Generative space scenes with an illustrative look.

Use the capture functions to export in big after opening it in its own window, the artwork is full of details.

Press SPACE to show/hide the menu

Control the camera and explore the scene with :
- Mouse Left : Rotate
- Mouse Right : Pan
- Mouse Middle : Zoom

I wrote an article about the project, with a technical breakdown of the piece at https://ulucode.com/wp/visa-to-the-stars/


Decent GPU REQUIRED, you can tune the performances with the "Quality" setting in the menu.
Better performances with Chrome.

Keyboard shortcuts:
SPACE : show/hide menu
A : toggle anti-aliasing
C : take a capture of the ccurrently selected resolution
R : reset camera position/orientation
S : display stats
P : pause animation

metadata.name: Silver Wires #20
metadata.description:
Concept:
Every beeing in the universe has a silver wire that connects its soul to a physical form.The silver wires are also connected to something much bigger, some would say it's the universe, god or whatever.

Technical information:
This is an interactive and generative piece made in P5JS. Lines connecting to dots. Thanks to kali for the postprocessing bloom shader.

Interaction:
-Hold and drag each node to move it and configure a new visualization of the silver wires.

Variations:
-Amount of threads. 
-Colors.
-Amount of nodes.

metadata.name: MoodColors #20
metadata.description: The artwork is based on principles of Orphism and Bauhaus , as one of the most striking examples of a combination of functionality, simplicity and at the same time the ability to convey the underlying meaning, where the form is determined by function. Where color is one of the most important values. Our goal is to visualize all the richness and versatility of human emotions with the help of color. What, if not color, is able to convey the whole gamut of feelings and experiences that we experience.  Every bright event in our life, both positive and negative, always leaves its mark in our memory. We show it through lines – it's like wrinkles on the face, marks of the experience, like a note on a sheet, a dash / tick, like an entry in the diary of life, where the sheet on which we made a note is colored in the color of emotions and sensations that we experienced again and again. It's always a lot of mixed shades that have their own unique palette.  The fundamental emotions and feelings such as anger, sadness, fear, disgust, joy and love are taken. Each token is one emotion, where with the help of color we show how multifaceted it can be.

metadata.name: Unicorn #4933
metadata.description:
All of us have dreams, and everyone would like to meet a fairy, a genie, a wizard, or someone else who will make our dreams come true in a snap of a finger or with the wave of a wand. But we're the only ones who can do it. We are those magical unicorns, unique, inimitable, with our own qualities and magical abilities.
These unicorns are the visualization of our inner selves that makes our dreams come true. An embodiment of all the best with a huge positive magical power.

Twitter: @unicorn_nft_art
Web: https://unicorn-nft.web.app/

by @lucky26puch, @AgataBaranova17
Made in 2022

License: CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Solutions #29
metadata.description:
“Solutions” is the eighth collection released as a part of NeoMent's "Abandoned Reality" series.

All problems have a solution, there are absolutely no exceptions to this rule. But why do so much awful things still exist? Well, there are many possiblities:
 - The problem is profitable for those who are working on the solution, thus in reality they would never want to solve it
 - The problem doesn't exist, it's either made up or misinterpreted
 - Fixing the problem would inflict more harm than good
 - The solution wasn't found yet
 - The solution isn't what was expected, thus it's being denied

metadata.name: DON'T THINK #210
metadata.description: WHAT YOU SEE IS WHAT YOU SEE

metadata.name: Saturday Night's Alright (For Fighting) #68
metadata.description:
Ok, this is just for fun!
An NFT that changes every day based on the browser weekday.

The preview is generated accordingly, hence it will be different based on the day of the mint.

Control Keys:
- 0 -> Sunday
- 1 -> Monday
- 2 -> Tuesday
- 3 -> Wednesday
- 4 -> Thursday
- 5 -> Friday
- 6 -> Saturday!
- S -> save png
- H -> save high res png

metadata.name: DON'T THINK #432
metadata.description: WHAT YOU SEE IS WHAT YOU SEE

metadata.name: Antigravity #374
metadata.description:
To change size or quality, open the IPFS link in a separate window and append to its url a string like `&quality=400&tiles=9,16`. You may notice two parameters in it: `quality` and `tiles`.

`quality` is an integer from 1 to ~1000, the better the quality — the slower the rendering. Default is 200.

`tiles` is a number of 256×256 px tiles to render. Can be an integer (for square images) or two integers separated with a comma (for rectangular). `tiles=9,16` will make an image with width of 9×256 px = 2304 px and height of 16×256 px = 4096 px. If not set, adapts to screen size.

Press `s` to save the image.

metadata.name: Patches #129
metadata.description:
This token generates a colorful abstract artwork that appears as watercolor on fabric. Project began as exploration of palettes used in famous masterpieces listed on Color Lisa web site. 97 color combinations used by great artists are applied here on abstract art.

Each piece is generated by bio inspired cellular automata in which colors from chosen palette are competing for domination on canvas. There are three different configurations of space fragmentation and each one is producing specific style.

metadata.name: Herbarium #777
metadata.description:
"Herbarium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Occasionally, I stumble upon vintage scientific illustrations on various topics, exotically looking charts and graphs, alternative layouts for the periodic tables or psychological research diagrams, elaborate illustrations of botany and zoology, minerals, and natural and sometimes unnatural phenomena. Most of those illustrations are part of the "art and science" practices from the 18th and 19th centuries. At the core of those practices were observation and interpretation, unraveling complexity through visualizing abstract ideas or finding a creative approach for understanding previously incomprehensible forms. 

I'm an admirer of two female pioneers in the field. Maria Sibylla Merian created, with immense dedication, a book with intricate illustrations of plants and insects, later praised by scientists. On the other hand, Anna Atkins published a book with beautiful botanical cyanotypes, considered the first book with photographic images. These topics are the visual inspiration for pieces presented at ArtBasel HK. 

My mathematical background makes me naturally attracted to graphs, converting numbers to curves, and everything schematically displayed. Also, combining scientific symbols and illustrations with imaginary data inspires the spectator to find meaning in unrelated or random things or provokes latent skepticism towards assumed concepts of truth, reality, and knowledge.

metadata.name: Decadence #186
metadata.description:
Decadence should not be misunderstood. Over time, the word has had various meanings (political and cultural) but has also been associated with Symbolism and Aestheticism.

The contemporary definition of decadence emerged in the late 19th century and praised artifice over nature, sophistication over simplicity, at the same time defying contemporary discourse of decline by embracing subjects and styles that critics considered over-refined. 

Nowadays, decadence also refers to stagnation and intellectual exhaustion at a high level of material prosperity and technological development which leads to an excessive indulgence in pleasure or luxury.

In this context, Decadence is a reflection on the collaboration between Jerome Herr and David Mrugala (thedotisblack). A collaboration that started several months ago with a simple grid of random values, that soon became an experiment of creativity, always in the search of expectations, interest in excessive indulgence of visual pleasure, a fascination with the bizarre, all packaged in a series of generative images with an aesthetics that values excess – That is Decadence.

- press 's' to save a standard image
- press 'h' to save a high resolution image

Jerome Herr

Jerome Herr is from Luxembourg. Since 2015 he has created generative art with a passion for design and visual explorations. He is an active member of the creative coding community and a successful NFT artist, both on Teia and Fxhash.

David Mrugala

David is a German architect and intermedia artist, who lives in South Korea. He is the founder of thedotisblack, a platform and an archive for research design on (generative) drawings and animations made with code.

metadata.name: Nil #220
metadata.description:
A balanced combination of spatial subdivision and algorithm sonification. A subdivision surface algorithm is recursive in nature: the process starts with a base level of area, and a refinement scheme is then applied to this field. This process takes that element and subdivides it, creating new segmented areas. The positions of the new areas are computed based on the positions of nearby old fields, edges, and/or faces. A cellular automata is running on the texture of some of these areas, building continuous, tautological worlds of binary patterns and relationships. Thus, unfolding of a pixel’s ‘umwelt’ can be witnessed through the slow, contemplative process.

The audio synthesis consists of a stochastic melody that emerges along the division of the new areas and territories within the image structure. This melody is complemented with tiny micro sounds, triggered by each new generation of the surface mounted cellular automata. 

Touch to listen

metadata.name: Afterglow Kaleido #196
metadata.description:
Afterglow Kaleido explores the variaty of organically animated shapes combined with the kaleidoscope (multi-mirroring) technique and an afterglow effect.
Generative token varies in mirror-count, animation-direction, -speed, size and complexity.

In Live-View or when iframe is focused...
...click/tap or hit space to pause animation
...hit 'r' or tap with 3 fingers to reset animation to initial, paused state.


Created with p5.js using post5.

- @TeNinEightNFTs
